docs.lead_paragraph: A city measure requiring retailers to warn cellphone customers about radiation exposure is on hold pending a lawsuit from the wireless industry.

headline.main: Cellphone Ordinance Puts Berkeley at Forefront of Radiation Debate
headline.print_headline: Berkeley Offers Safety Guidance on Carrying Phones

docs.abstract: Berkeley, Calif, passes law requiring cellphone retailers to inform customers about hazards of products with regards to cancer-causing radiation exposure; cellphone industry files lawsuit against city.
docs.snippet: A city measure requiring retailers to warn cellphone customers about radiation exposure is on hold pending a lawsuit from the wireless industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Money to repair highways, rising health care costs and controversies surrounding attempts to combat global warming are among topics the nation's governors plan to tackle when they gather this week in West Virginia.

headline.main: From Highways to Health Care, Challenges Confront Governors
headline.print_headline: From Highways to Health Care, Challenges Confront Governors

docs.snippet: Money to repair highways, rising health care costs and controversies surrounding attempts to combat global warming are among topics the nation's governors plan to tackle when they gather this week in West Virginia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Her belly bulging, Hilda Angarita hauls herself to five different drug stores in the sweltering Venezuelan city of Maracaibo until she finally finds post-cesarean patches.

headline.main: Mother of All Battles in Scarcity-Hit Venezuela: Having a Baby
headline.print_headline: Mother of All Battles in Scarcity-Hit Venezuela: Having a Baby

docs.lead_paragraph: The 11 million Americans who receive Social Security disability face steep benefit cuts next year, the government said Wednesday, handing lawmakers a fiscal and political crisis in the middle of a presidential campaign.

headline.main: Report: Social Security Disability Fund to Run Dry Next Year
headline.print_headline: Report: Social Security Disability Fund to Run Dry Next Year

docs.snippet: The 11 million Americans who receive Social Security disability face steep benefit cuts next year, the government said Wednesday, handing lawmakers a fiscal and political crisis in the middle of a presidential campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.

headline.main: Health Care Tax Faces United Opposition From Labor and Employers

docs.abstract: Many employers are concerned about looming burden of Cadillac Tax--40 percent excise tax on more expensive health care plans--that will take effect as part of Affordable Care Act in 2018; some companies have begun accelerating efforts to introduce less expensive plans, while others have joined with labor unions to push for repeal of tax.
docs.snippet: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.
